channel.title: Home Page on FEEC/UNICAMP IA382 - Seminar in Computer Engineering
channel.description: Recent content in Home Page on FEEC/UNICAMP IA382 - Seminar in Computer Engineering

item.title: The Dawn of Low Latency and the Death of Bandwidth
item.description: Abstract # This seminar will explore how end user bandwidth capacity and latency affects the quality of end user application experiences.

item.title: 5 Key Pillars of Telco Cloud Evolution
item.description: Abstract # Network operators who manage private cloud infrastructure for hosting telecoms workloads and applications must continuously scale-up, optimise and adapt their platform to meet the needs of diverse “tenants” hosted on such infrastructure.

item.title: Open RAN: Technological Foundations and Market Dynamics
item.description: Abstract # This seminar explores the transformative potential of Open RAN, connecting technological insights with market dynamics.

item.title: Fast, Flexible, and Intelligent Next-Generation Networks and Systems
item.description: Abstract # Maintaining strict security and performance objectives in next-generation cloud and edge networks demands that compute-intensive management and control decisions are made on the current state of the entire network (e.

item.title: Sensing Without Seeing: EM Approaches to High-resolution Non-contact Detection
item.description: Abstract # Electromagnetic (EM) sensing is rapidly emerging as a compelling alternative to traditional visual and optical methods in real-time detection, offering advantages in sensitivity, selectivity, and resilience in harsh environments or complex sensing medium.

item.title: How Computer Vision At The Edge Is Changing The Way Products Are Made
item.description: Abstract # At one time or another, nearly everyone has wished they could be in two places at once.

item.title: Towards an AI-native 6G system architecture
item.description: Abstract # The next generation of mobile communications is expected to revolutionize connectivity through the integration of advanced artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities into its core architecture.

item.title: Challenges in Deploying a High-Performance SDN Network to Support the World’s Largest Optical Telescope
item.description: Abstract # The Vera Rubin Observatory, the world’s largest optical telescope, presents a set of operational requirements that have created numerous challenges across all involved domains—from architecture to logistics, from materials to computer networks.

item.title: Cloud Gaming (CG) & Extended Reality (XR/AR): Network Traffic Patterns & challenges in Network Management
item.description: Abstract # Cloud Gaming and Augmented/Extended Reality (AR/XR) are reshaping interactive digital experiences, requiring ultra-low latency, high throughput, and reliable connectivity to deliver real-time responsiveness and immersive QoE.

item.title: Quantum Algorithms: Computational Foundations and Engineering Challenge
item.description: Abstract # In this seminar, we will explore quantum algorithms from the perspective of Computer Engineering, covering both their theoretical foundations and the practical challenges of implementation across different quantum computing paradigms.

item.title: Internet Architecture Evolution: Found in Translation
item.description: Abstract # The success of the Internet is undeniable, but so are its limitations.

item.title: More is different: How the Science of Complex Systems can inspire Future Autonomous Networks
item.description: Abstract # It is expected that future mobile networks will be ultra-large-scale, highly dynamic, and complex systems, encompassing a massive number of heterogeneous devices.

item.title: Let the Plants do the Talking: Climate-Smart Agriculture by the Messages Received from Plants and Soil
item.description: Abstract # As reported in the report recently issued by the United Nations (Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change – IPCC Report 2021), the benefits that technology provides to a green and sustainable economy are highly appreciated and under intense research and development globally.

item.title: Cloud Storage Systems: Latency Characterization and Extensions
item.description: Abstract # Consumers are engaged in more social networking and E-commerce activities these days and are increasingly storing their documents and media in the online storage.

item.title: Scientific Machine Learning and Quantum Utility: A Near Future Perspective
item.description: Abstract # In 2021, Gartner Inc.

item.title: Packet Trimming at the Edge for Low Latency in 6G Environments
item.description: Abstract # The talk presents the use of packet trimming, a technique which adjusts the size of a packet during its transmission over the network, and has the ability to provide low latency and low loss at the client.

item.title: An Overview of Evolutionary Multi-Objective Optimization
item.description: Abstract # Multi-objective optimization refers to solving problems having two or more (often conflicting) objectives at the same time.

item.title: From Intelligent Surfaces to Noise-Driven Communication: Innovative Technologies for 6G and Beyond
item.description: Abstract # Our community has witnessed the rise of many exciting communication technologies in recent years.

item.title: Generalist vs Specialist Language Models
item.description: Abstract # We are currently experiencing a paradigm shift in the field of artificial intelligence, where with every new version of a large language model, tasks that once seemed far from being solved are now being addressed.

item.title: AGI Chips - The Next Frontier
item.description: Abstract # General intelligence is a branch of AI research that aims to create machines capable of understanding and learning any intellectual task that a human can.

item.title: The Dawn of an Immersive Internet: XR, Generative AI and the Road to 6G
item.description: Abstract # This IEEE ComSoc Virtual Distinguished Lecture offers a timely and comprehensive exploration into the emergence of the next-generation internet.

item.title: Advances in Holographic-Type Communications
item.description: Abstract # This talk will give an overview of video streaming technologies over telecommunication networks, while also taking the important evolution towards network softwarizaton into account.

item.title: Talking to Machines: A Practical introduction to Generative AI
item.description: Abstract # Generative AI is changing the way we interact with technology.

item.title: Next Generation Wireless for Time-critical Performance
item.description: Abstract # This talk will discuss recent developments on distributed computing and wireless communications to enable time-sensitive systems and applications, such as virtualized industrial automation, mobile robots, autonomous vehicles, and new immersive user experiences.

item.title: Latest trends on supporting an energy-efficient and resilient IoT-Edge-Cloud continuum
item.description: Abstract # The Edge to Cloud continuum defines the overall computing, network and data management required to handle services across an Internet of Things (IoT).

item.title: Revolutionizing Medical Imaging Diagnostics with AI​
item.description: Abstract # Medical imaging is an essential tool for diagnostics and health management.

item.title: IoT for Social Good​
item.description: Abstract # In this talk, I will describe some of our current projects on using Internet of Things (IoT) to tackle a range of applications that address timely societal problems including environment, climate and health.

item.title: To Offload or not to Offload?
item.description: Abstract # The slowdown of Moore’s Law, the end of Dennard’s scaling, and the rapid adoption of high-bandwidth links is creating new challenges when building high-performance end-host network stacks and when dealing with network function virtualization.

item.title: Digital Twins in 6G network automation​
item.description: Abstract # 6G will enable a “cyber-physical continuum”, where the network provides intelligence, limitless connectivity, and full synchronization of the physical and digital worlds.

item.title: Visão geral sobre Blockchain: Conceitos, aplicações e iniciativas relevantes
item.description: Abstract # A palestra vai apresentar:

item.title: A Bioengineering View on Optical Network Openness and Automation
item.description: Abstract # This talk will first review trends in optical networking and SDN.

item.title: IA: a longa e tortuosa jornada do laboratório à produção
item.description: Abstract # Aos poucos estamos saindo da fase do hype, onde é “cool” colocar IA no nome da startup e em todo e qualquer projeto, para dar visibilidade e atrair investidores, para a fase da maturidade, onde aprendemos com as experiências vividas, acertos e fracassos.

item.title: Holographic Type Communication: a future nearer than ever
item.description: Abstract # This keynote talk will first give an introduction about Immersive communications in 6G systems, highlighting Holographic-Type Communications (HTC).

item.title: O Estado-da-Arte da I.A. na Área de Linguagem Natural: Por que a IA Generativa é o avanço mais disruptivo em toda a história da IA
item.description: Abstract # Nesta palestra, vou fazer um breve histórico dos avanços na área de Processamento de Linguagem Natural com ênfase nos últimos 5 anos, até o surgimento da chamada IA Generativa que culminou com a chegado dos LLM (Large Language Models) no estilo do chatGPT.

item.title: Contact
The Global Network Advancement Group: Towards a Next Generation System for Data Intensive Sciences
item.description: Abstract # The Global Network Advancement Group (GNA-G) has brought together the major R&E and mission oriented networks and major data intensive science programs to enable the best use of networks and computing facilities worldwide, while developing the next generation of programmable national and intercontinental networks and distributed systems designed to address the most challenging needs of leading edge programs in a manner compatible with continued excellent service to the at-large academic and research communities.

item.title: Welcome!
item.description: Abstract # Following the state of the art is paramount for sound and impact scientific practices informed strategic R&D decisions.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: In this page, you can find the upcoming events!

item.title: About
item.description: IA382 is a 02 credits online graduate seminar class offered by the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering ( FEEC) at the University of Campinas ( UNICAMP), to discuss state-of-art topics in the broad field of Computer Engineering.
